title: What is the meaning of the Tool song Jambi? - Quora

response.answer_text: Many elements of the song are based on a rather psychadelic-friendly children’s TV show from the early 90s called Pee Wee’s Playhouse. An occasional character on that show was a genie named Jambi, who uses a magical phrase “meka leka hi meka hiney ho.” The rhythm of the song’s main riff strongly resembles the rhythm of the magical phrase. Indeed, drummer Danny Carey has admitted that the name Jambi came from Pee Wee’s Playhouse. Additionally, I believe there is a very strong chance, from the sound of it, that guitarist Adam Jones is saying something along the lines of “meka leka hi….. meka leka hiney ho” into his talk box at the end of the talk-box guitar solo. The vowel sounds and syllables coincide. Besides, why else introduce a talk box?! Does that mean the song is about Pee Wee? No, that’s the amateur approach to art critique—tracing one allusion and then stopping there as if the mystery is solved. If the meaning of the song Jambi is Jambi from Pee Wee’s Playhouse, we can’t stop there. The question, then, is what is the meaning of Jambi from Pee Wee’s Playhouse?
